; Wed, 20 Sep 2023 23:55:03 +0800 引资、清欠、对接客户，民营经济发展局的地方经验http://www.infzm.com/contents/257186
;;2023-09-20 23:00:00;
;

;;

;

;On September 4, 2023, Cong Liang, deputy director of the National Development and Reform Commission, introduced that the Central Committee The Editorial Office officially approved the establishment of the Private Economic Development Bureau within the National Development and Reform Commission. ;(Visual China/Photo);

;

;Once the Private Economic Development Bureau was established, it attracted the attention of the whole society.

;

;On September 4, 2023, Cong Liang, deputy director of the National Development and Reform Commission, introduced that the Central Organization Office officially approved the establishment of a Private Economic Development Bureau within the National Development and Reform Commission. It is a specialized agency to promote the development and growth of the private economy. Its role is to strengthen the overall coordination of policies in related fields and promote the implementation of various major measures.

;

;Cong Liang introduced that the main responsibility of the bureau is to formulate policies to promote private economic development and establish a communication mechanism with private enterprises. In the more than 100-word description of responsibilities, there is no word related to "management", but "service" is the main word.

;

;This is the first time a private economic development bureau has been established at the national ministry level, but it is no stranger to it at the local level.

;

;Southern Weekend reporters searched Qichacha and local government official websites and found that at the peak of the country, there were more than 200 related agencies such as private economic development bureaus, private economic development promotion bureaus, and private economic development service bureaus. Now, There are still more than 180 private economic development bureaus.

;

;They belong to different departments in different places. For example, the local industry and information technology departments will have small and medium-sized enterprise development agencies, and the market supervision department will also have internal agencies to promote the private economy. The human resources and social security, taxation, judicial, and financial supervision departments will also have corresponding service offices as needed.

;

;The starting point was around 2000. At that time, some provinces, cities, districts and counties began to set up departments related to private economic development, and added the brands of Township Enterprise Administration or Small and Medium Enterprises Bureau, and then the names would be many times. change. After 2019, local small and medium-sized enterprise bureaus were abolished under institutional reform and adjustment, and have now become subordinate offices of local industry and information bureaus, economic and information bureaus or market supervision bureaus.

;

;Most of the relevant institutions add a brand to the existing institutions, that is, one team and two brands. Only a few areas have set up a separate "Private Economic Development Bureau" as a municipal government agency. Government departments, such as Qingdao, Ya'an, Jinan, Chongqing Beibei District, Chongqing Jiulongpo District, etc., are generally established after 2019.

;

;What kind of exploration experience and inspiration can these local experiences provide to national departments?

;

;;Private bureaus have long existed in many places;

;

;As early as around 2000, some provincial governments already had agencies responsible for the private economy, named Township Enterprise Administration Bureau, Private Economic Administration Bureau, Small and Medium Enterprises Bureau, etc.

;

;After several institutional reforms, their figures have been blurred. Now, their development can only be seen through public documents such as cadre resumes, budget and final accounts of the year, unit profiles, and function introductions on the government’s official website.

;

;For example, the resume of a cadre from the Industry and Information Technology Bureau of Yucheng City, Dezhou City, Shandong Province stated that he worked for the Private Economic Development Bureau of Yucheng City from 1997 to 2013. After that, the company he worked for was changed to the Economic and Information Technology Bureau of Yucheng City. Bureau of Industry and Information Technology, and will become Yucheng City Industry and Information Technology Bureau after 2019.

;

;For another example, the Shanxi Luliang Lishi District Small and Medium Enterprises Service Center details its development history in the official website introduction. Its predecessor was the Lishi County Community and Team Enterprise Management Bureau in 1976, and was changed to the Lishi County Community and Team Enterprise Management Bureau in 1984. The Lishi County Township Enterprise Administration Bureau established the Lishi Township Enterprise Service Center after the organizational reform in 2002, and was listed as the Lishi Private Economic Development Bureau. This agency began to be responsible for the supervision, guidance, coordination and services of small and medium-sized enterprises, township enterprises and the private economy in the region. In August 2004, it was renamed "Lishi District Small and Medium Enterprises Bureau" again, retaining the brand of "Lishi District Private Economic Development Bureau".

;

;According to the book "Shanxi Economy: Forty Years of Reform and Opening Up", in 2003, Shanxi Province adjusted its organizational structure and transitioned the provincial-level Township Enterprise Administration Bureau to the Private Economic Development Bureau. The following year, it added It has the sign of Shanxi Provincial Small and Medium Enterprises Bureau. Since then, 11 prefecture-level cities and 119 counties and cities in Shanxi Province have established small and medium-sized enterprise bureaus, and their functions have been expanded from the original township enterprises to county economies, private economies, and small and medium-sized enterprises.

;

;Li Xiaofeng, director of the Office of Private Economic Development Bureau of Qingdao, Shandong Province, told Southern Weekend reporters that before and after the institutional reform in 2019, small and medium-sized enterprise bureaus across the country were withdrawn and merged, and the functions of the original small and medium-sized enterprise bureaus were merged into the local industry and information bureaus and economic bureaus. The Information Bureau and the Market Supervision Bureau will add the Small and Medium Enterprises Bureau brand to these departments.

;

;Currently, the Industry and Information Technology Bureaus of Taiyuan City, Shuozhou City, Luliang City, Yangquan City, Yuncheng City and other places in Shanxi Province have added the name of Private Economic Development Promotion Bureau, and the districts and counties under their jurisdiction have also The Ministry of Industry and Information Technology has added the name of the Private Economic Development Promotion Bureau.

;

;Wenzhou has added the name of the Private Economic Health Development Promotion Bureau to the Municipal Economic and Information Technology Bureau. Guang'an, Zigong and Ziyang in Sichuan Province have also registered private economic development bureaus in the Economic and Information Bureau, while Neijiang, Aba and Liangshan prefectures have registered private economic development bureaus in the Market Supervision Bureau.

;

;Over the past two decades, the emergence of private economic development bureaus in local government agencies has roughly coincided with the peak of the central government’s policies to encourage the development of the private economy.

;

;In 2005, the "36 Non-Public Economy Articles" was the first central document to promote the development of the non-public economy since the founding of New China. In 2019, the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China and the State Council issued the "Opinions on Creating a Better Development Environment to Support the Reform and Development of Private Enterprises" to support the private economy in many aspects. In 2023, the "Opinions of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China and the State Council on Promoting the Development and Growth of the Private Economy" was publicly released, proposing 31 policies and measures to encourage and promote private enterprises to become better, bigger and stronger.

;

;;Need a comprehensive coordination department;

;

;In 2015, Li Xiaofeng worked in the Private Economic Development Division of the Enterprise Registration Bureau under the Qingdao Municipal Administration for Industry and Commerce, doing comprehensive coordination for private enterprises The work includes formulating the key points of the national private economy work and gathering relevant data on private market entities that were originally scattered in various departments. "It is better to do macro-level work and understand the overall situation."

;

;The scope of the work of the Industrial and Commercial Bureau on the private economy is limited to this. Although other departments also have work related to the private economy, they are all in Fulfill responsibilities within their respective scope.

;

;In 2019, the Qingdao Municipal Government carried out institutional reforms. Under the condition of a limit of 38 working departments, the Private Economic Development Bureau and the Ocean Bureau were added to the reform plan. These two bureaus became components of the municipal government. .

;

;At that time, Li Xiaofeng was transferred to the Private Economic Development Bureau and served successively as the director of the Coordination and Guidance Division and the director of the office.

;

;He explained to Southern Weekend reporters that in the past, although different units had departments serving the private economy, their focus was different due to functional limitations. For example, the Ministry of Industry and Information Technology pays more attention to industrial enterprises and their industries, while departments such as science and technology and commerce focus on high-tech, consumer enterprises and their industry development. A full-time department must be established to cover all aspects of private economic development.

;

;Compared with the original agency, Li Xiaofeng found that the private economic development bureau, a dedicated department, can play a better coordination role. "We are now doing comprehensive coordination, platform building and other service work, not industry authorities." , closer to the role of the integrated department.”

;

;The advantage of this role is that it facilitates coordination between various departments.

;

;“Private economic work covers a wide range of areas and is highly policy-oriented, requiring close collaboration among various departments to form a synergy.” Zhang Shixin, deputy secretary-general of the National Development and Reform Commission and director of the Personnel Department, also made a similar statement in an interview. The National Development and Reform Commission established the Private Economic Development Bureau in order to better play the role of overall coordination, comprehensive policy implementation, and promotion of development.

;

;However, Li Xiaofeng believes that at the national level, the Private Economic Development Bureau is an internal agency of the National Development and Reform Commission. There is no need to dissolve and merge relevant departments that have been established separately but are not placed in the National Development and Reform Commission. "Serving private enterprises inherently involves coordination and cooperation among multiple departments, and there will be no overlapping or conflicting functions."

;

;"Now Qingdao's private economy does not support half the sky, but is the main force." Li Xiaofeng told the South Weekend reporter, Qingdao’s private investment can still maintain double-digit growth from 2019 to 2020. From January to July 2023, Qingdao's private investment grew by 6.1%, 6.6 percentage points higher than the national average. Private investment projects under construction drove investment by 3.6 percentage points and contributed 77.3% to the city's investment growth.

;

;The Office of Jinan Private Economic Development Bureau wrote a reply to Southern Weekend reporter: The bureau was established in March 2019. In the first half of 2019, the number of private market entities in Jinan was 993,300, and currently it is 1.505 million, accounting for 98.6% of the city’s market entities.

;

;;Serving private enterprises that meet industrial needs;

;

;The first step in providing good services is to let private enterprises and local private bureaus understand each other.

;

;On the one hand, the Qingdao Private Enterprise Bureau understands the situation of private enterprises through streets, districts and cities, and has set up 300 enterprise policy service specialists composed of government personnel and enterprise service agencies. On the other hand, it sets up a system for private enterprises through gradient cultivation and management. Different growth tracks, discover small and medium-sized enterprises with development potential.

;

;Qingdao Yunlu Co., Ltd. (688190.SH) project leader Geng Runer told Southern Weekend reporters that receiving the honorary title from the government is an affirmation of the company and provides a measurement standard for investment institutions and financial institutions to judge the value of the company. , which helps corporate financing to a certain extent.

;

;Yunlu Co., Ltd. is engaged in the design, development and sales of advanced magnetic metal materials. It is a mixed-ownership enterprise with shares held by central enterprises. Geng Runer is mainly responsible for project declaration and other work. She said the company has become a unicorn with support from the local government.

;

;In Qingdao’s 2023 public list of innovative small and medium-sized enterprises, most of the awarded companies are high-tech and other new manufacturing industries, with occasionally one or two companies related to the food and clothing industries.

;

;The person in charge of a Qingdao garment factory told Southern Weekend reporters, "We may have contacted the private bureau, but we don't know much about it." The main dilemma faced by enterprises at present is the high labor cost. Many garment factories in the industry have moved to Southeast Asia, India and other places with lower labor costs. Her company mainly undertakes OEM foreign trade orders.

;

;“Many people would rather earn a salary of 3,000 yuan in an urban office than work in a factory. (The salary) is over 6,000 yuan and no one comes,” she said. She is now also seeking transformation for the company, no longer following the OEM model, and trying to operate her own brand through the Internet platform.

;

;Li Xiaofeng said that every local government has its own industries that it focuses on developing. Qingdao has 24 key industrial chains, which are consistent with Qingdao’s urban industrial planning and development needs. Textile and clothing is an advantageous industrial chain among the 24 industrial chains. For example, Qingdao Kute Intelligent Enterprise has found a transformation path in personalized intelligent customization of clothing. "It still depends on whether the enterprise's model and core competitiveness can adapt to the development and changes of the social situation, so as to effectively respond to the market-oriented survival of the fittest."

;

;In Jinan, the main practices of the private bureau include establishing private economic monitoring and analysis services The system monitors and analyzes comprehensive indicators such as operating income, profits and taxes, and R&D investment, and dynamically grasps the development of private enterprises. The bureau also requested the municipal government to issue "Several Measures on Carrying out Climbing Actions to Support the Leapfrog Development of Private Enterprises", clearly implement 21 cultivation measures in 5 major actions including financing promotion, and carry out a 5-year targeted cultivation.

;

;A staff member of a cryptographic company located in Jinan said that the relevant departments of the Jinan Municipal Government have helped them solve issues such as office space property rights and matching financing needs.

;

;A staff member of another biopharmaceutical company located in Jinan told Southern Weekend reporters that they are a leading company in the local area. Jinan’s business environment has developed greatly in recent years, and the city has set up dedicated services for leading companies. "After all, large companies are large and make great contributions." He affirmed the work of the government, but also said that it is difficult to address all aspects of enterprise personalized issues and provide adequate services.

;

;At present, Jinan’s four leading industries are big data and new generation information technology industry, intelligent manufacturing and high-end equipment industry, biomedicine and comprehensive health industry, and high-quality steel and advanced materials industry.

;

;;When do businesses need the government? ;

;

;Due to his work, Li Xiaofeng often comes into contact with private enterprises of various sizes.

;

;In his view, in the past when enterprises dealt with the government, they hoped that the government would not disturb them. However, in critical periods such as the early stages of enterprise development and bottleneck periods, the government also needs to provide resource support.

;

;Geng Runer once represented the company in a creative meeting organized by the Private Economic Development Bureau, and the company put forward development demands with creative solutions. The plan jointly submitted by Yunlu Co., Ltd. and downstream companies is amorphous high-efficiency energy-saving transformers. The main customers are local power supply bureaus and urban rail transit.

;

;A creative meeting will invite 3-5 companies to share their proposals. In addition to business representatives, there were also government staff, project reviewers and invited customer representatives present.

;

;Recommending products to state-owned enterprise users on government platforms is undoubtedly a shortcut to quickly open up customer sources and build trust between both parties. Two months after the creative meeting, Yunlu Co., Ltd. successfully participated in the communication and promotion meeting for the follow-up project implementation.

;

;Li Xiaofeng told Southern Weekend reporters that companies of all sizes participating in the creative meeting will be selected in the early stage. The ideas proposed by the companies will be selected. The selected ideas will be fully demonstrated by experts from the private sector bureau and relevant government departments, and they are in line with Qingdao’s industry. Projects in the development direction can enter subsequent promotion meetings, and coordinate various relevant departments to resolve the resources needed for project and industrial development, such as land, talents, funds, etc., which are generally concerned by enterprises. Since 2019, more than ten events have been held, attracting an investment amount of approximately 40 billion yuan.

;

;Geng Runer said that because they are in a "stuck" industry such as key materials technology, there is an urgent need for talents. The Private Sector Bureau and the Human Resources and Social Security Bureau helped the company introduce a Japanese expert and solved the problem for the expert. Talent green card issue.

;

;In terms of funding, Li Xiaofeng introduced that in addition to certain rewards and subsidies for some companies after listing, the Financing Cooperation Office of the Private Sector Bureau will also organize matchmaking activities such as "Government, Bank and Enterprise" to guide private companies in need to connect with finance. Institutions, companies raise financial needs, and financial institutions promote products. "Compared with the company going door to door to find banking institutions, he can contact eight to ten financial institutions once he participates in the matching event."

;

;Jinan Private Economic Development Bureau also mentioned in its written reply that they established The Cultivation Database of Ten Thousand Potential Enterprises, the Cultivation Database of Thousands of Key Enterprises and the Database of Hundreds of Investment Institutions have connected local private enterprises to obtain 280 rounds of fund investment. At the same time, it also promotes the connection between corporate financing needs and banks.

;

;Liang Sheng is the head of a company that provides service products to government departments. His company has conducted business in many places across the country and mainly obtained government procurement projects through bidding.

;

;In his view, most private enterprises that provide service products to the government will inevitably encounter the problem of "difficulty in collecting accounts". It often happens that the accounts are delayed, and some private enterprises will also Encountered a situation where "new officials ignore old accounts".

;

;In August 2023, the National Development and Reform Commission and other departments issued 28 specific measures to promote the solution of outstanding problems faced in the development of the private economy, including increasing efforts to clean up the accounts owed to private enterprises, focusing on cleaning up Accounts owed to small, medium and micro enterprises by government agencies, institutions, and state-owned enterprises, etc.

;

;Li Xiaofeng introduced that the Qingdao Private Sector Bureau has been paying attention to this problem since its early establishment and began to clear arrears for small and medium-sized enterprises in 2019. As long as the enterprise raises the issue, the private sector bureau will take the lead in issuing supervision orders to government departments that are confirmed to have delinquent accounts after investigation, urging them to pay off the delinquent accounts owed to small and medium-sized enterprises in installments.

; Wed, 20 Sep 2023 23:25:05 +0800 室同道合？一份包含MBTI的大学宿舍分配问卷背后http://www.infzm.com/contents/257236

;

;;

;

;; (Nongjian/Picture) ;

;

;There is still one week before the start of the semester. On the evening of August 10, 2023, 115 undergraduate freshmen in the class of 2023 at the Zhiyi Academy of Beijing Institute of Technology received a questionnaire, including MBTI, favorite " "Idol" (idol, refers to idol artists), as well as work and rest habits. This questionnaire is prepared for freshman dormitory assignment.

;

;Before dawn the next day, the dormitory list was released. The person who was commissioned to design the questionnaire was their senior sister, Lu Jiahui, a 2022 student of Zhiyi Academy. Her original intention in designing the questionnaire was to bring people in the same circle together based on the results of the questionnaire, "so that they can spend their four years in college more happily." .

;

;Lv Jiahui’s own dormitory experience was somewhat regretful. The roommates had different hobbies and “basically had nothing to talk about.”

;

;Soon, this questionnaire was posted on social media, and the topic "BIT Dormitory Allocation Statistics MBTI" became a hot search topic.

;

;In the past, dormitory allocation in colleges and universities was often done randomly. Nowadays, more and more colleges and universities are exploring other methods, and MBTI is just the latest one. Nanjing University and Chengdu University use questionnaires to collect information about freshmen, and then assign or recommend roommates to them through algorithms; while some schools such as Communication University of China and Zhuhai Institute of Science and Technology (formerly Jilin University Zhuhai College) give students the right to choose. Spontaneously organize and publish "resumes" written with their living habits, personality and hobbies to find suitable roommates.

;

;The seemingly various allocation methods are more or less designed to avoid possible conflicts in university dormitories. Wang Qing, a lecturer at the School of Humanities at Jiangxi University of Finance and Economics, has studied the relationship between university dormitories. She believes that "if these factors are taken into account when arranging dormitories, conflicts will be reduced to a certain extent."

;

;Behind the dormitory conflicts There is another deeper social and cultural change of youth. Wang Qing also agreed: dormitory allocation can only solve part of the contradiction.

;

;;"BIT Dormitory Allocation Statistics;;MBTI";

;

;The most concerning question in this dormitory allocation questionnaire is: MBTI is one of the most popular personality tests today.

;

;MBTI is the abbreviation of Myers-Briggs Type Indicator. The test result consists of 4 letters and refers to a person’s attention direction, cognitive style, judgment style and lifestyle. Dimensional tendencies. The framers were an American mother and daughter named Briggs and Myers respectively. In the eyes of this mother and daughter who had no professional background in psychology, they could use four rulers to classify complex human nature into 16 species.

;

;The MBTI test has been widely used in company recruitment and team building, but its scientific validity has also been questioned. Some studies have found that more than half of people retest after a few weeks or more than a year. , will get different results, so there are flaws in its consistency, stability and reliability.

;

;Lu Jiahui, who allocates dormitories to 115 freshmen, is a "peer mentor", that is, a senior who answers questions in the freshmen group. She believes in the accuracy of the MBTI. Her MBTI type is "entj", which is called a commander personality. This type of person tends to make quick decisions and has strong action ability. It only took her an hour and a half to complete the questionnaire design, and sent it out at 7:30 pm on the 10th. At 4:30 am on the 11th, the dormitory allocation results for the entire grade were sent to the group.

;

;The questionnaire was quickly posted online. On August 12, Lu Jiahui discovered that the entry "BIT dormitory allocation statistics MBTI" had been on the hot search list for nearly ten hours, ranking highest at second place.

;

;In addition to MBTI, the questionnaire also discussed whether snoring, talking in sleep, getting up at night, chasing stars, "two-spined salamander" (two-dimensional), etc.

;

;The questionnaire also attracted attention within BIT. “My counselor’s phone number was blown up by counselors from other colleges.” Then, the questionnaire became popular in the school. Someone left a screenshot of the same questionnaire on Lu Jiahui’s social media: “The College of Economics and Management also has it! ”

;

;This trend has spread to more colleges and universities. On August 29, a student at the School of Intelligent Accounting and Management of Guangdong University of Finance and Economics discovered that the questionnaire collected by her college for dormitory allocation only included MBTI types, and the final allocation results were mainly based on "i people" (introverts) and "e people" ” (extrovert) distinction.

;

;Ru Jingfei, a counselor at the School of Law of Southwest University of Political Science and Law, looks for inspiration in her own employment guidance and mental health classes. In addition to the MBTI, the questionnaire she designed also included "questions that are likely to cause conflicts in dormitory life" collected from graduates.

;

;In recent years, many colleges and universities have begun to reject the past "blind box" method, which is a randomly assigned dormitory allocation plan.

;

;In the past, dormitory allocation mainly considered students with the same major, class, and adjacent student numbers to be grouped together. The ordering of student numbers usually referred to the pinyin and strokes of the surname. There are also schools that arrange dormitories according to the order of registration.

;

;In 2022, Chengdu University asked freshmen to fill out a questionnaire including questions such as "Are you a social cow or a social fear" and "Do you accept durian, snail noodles and other odorous foods" to match freshmen with roommates. In the same year, according to the official account of Lanzhou University, in order to "allow students to choose like-minded roommates," some colleges introduced a method of allocating dormitories by selecting roommates from each other, and students posted self-introductions in the group like "writing a resume." and expectations for roommates, making a two-way choice. When the 2023 freshmen of the University of Electronic Science and Technology of China choose their own rooms online, they can check the waking up and sleeping habits of the selected roommates in a certain room.

;

;;

;

;On September 16, 2023, the seniors guided the 2023 freshmen to go through the registration procedures at Huzhou College in Zhejiang Province. ;(Visual China/Picture);

;

;;Yes;;iYes;;e A;;more interesting;;? ;

;

;Controversy also ensued: whether the roommates assigned through MBTI are reliable.

;

;In Lu Jiahui’s conception, MBTI is not the most important. Her priority was an open-ended fill-in-the-blank question about "other needs" in the questionnaire, and then the order of consideration was: personal work and rest habits, interests and hobbies, and then MBTI.

;

;In the open-ended fill-in-the-blank question, some people followed the prompts and filled in who they wanted to live with. If both parties were willing, they would be placed together; some people filled in "I don't want to be in the same dormitory with star chasers." ". Through the collected questionnaire answers, Lu Jiahui could not judge who could accept these unexpected demands, but she set a self-evaluation question about "tolerance", with a full score of 5 points - people with high self-evaluation scores were considered There is a greater chance of accepting the individual needs of roommates.

;

;In the dormitory allocation of the School of Intelligent Accounting and Management of Guangdong University of Finance and Economics, a freshman observed that the configuration is roughly "two i and two e" in one dormitory.

;

;Ru Jingfei did not directly judge which personalities are suitable. She reminded students to consider whether they need roommates with complementary or similar personalities. She also suggested that "Having I's and E's will make dormitory life more interesting."

;

;Different allocation methods are related to different needs. Even on the indicator of student origin, different people have different considerations. Southwest Political Science and Law is located in Chongqing. Ru Jingfei does not recommend that everyone in a dormitory come from the same place, and believes that "it is best to have someone from Sichuan and Chongqing in a dormitory, so that it will be much more convenient when going out to play." What Lu Jiahui is most afraid of is the difference in eating habits between the north and the south. "It's very uncomfortable if you can't eat one piece."

;

;Lanzhou University advocates "multicultural integration". One college stipulates that "each dormitory has students from the south and the north" and "no less than 3 provinces of origin." "Diversity" also has another meaning. In 2022, in order to avoid collective late arrival at "eight in the morning", the school's law school assigned a classmate who is accustomed to getting up early to each dormitory to serve as the "dawn rooster" of each dormitory.

;

;The plans vary, but what most designers care about is whether roommates can chat with each other.

;

;“Behind closed doors, the dormitory is just a circle.” A significant comparison is that the college dormitories of Lu Jiahui’s good friends are all “two-dimensional” and they can play well; and her own roommate , there are those who pursue Korean entertainment, and there are those who like racing, "basically there is nothing to talk about."

;

;Nanjing University has set up a questionnaire since 2017, which not only counts interests and hobbies, but also uses algorithms to find potential correlations between different hobbies. Guo Yamin, a teacher at the student affairs office of the school, once introduced to the media that the interests and hobbies of the "post-00s generation" are wide and highly dispersed. The school's "hidden semantic model" algorithm can use some implicit characteristics to deduce the students' possible hobbies from their existing hobbies. Match roommates based on your interests, such as putting those who like drama with those who like history, or those who like biology with those who like physics.

;

;Furthermore, Nanjing University’s questionnaire is adjusted every year. Guo Yamin explained to Southern Weekend reporters, “The concerns of each generation of children are different.” In the 2023 questionnaire, freshmen were asked whether they prefer the AA system (everyone shares the expenses equally) or taking turns to treat guests when going out with their roommates, and whether they can accept invitations from their roommates to go out with friends on weekends.

;

;Guo Yamin said, "Nowadays, children have lived alone since childhood. When they suddenly enter collective life, there are always a lot of discomforts." The school's approach is to try to reduce the "discomforts", Don't group people who are too different together.

;

;;A dormitory relationship intervention experiment;

;

;Wang Qing, a lecturer at the School of Humanities at Jiangxi University of Finance and Economics, once tried to find a set of methods for running-in university dormitory relationships through his own experiments. Methodology.

;

;Wang Qing has served as the head teacher for five years since 2016, and has actively or passively intervened in many dormitory conflicts. Some students asked her for help privately: They had a bad relationship with someone in the dormitory, which caused a lot of trouble.

;

;Before 2023, Jiangxi University of Finance and Economics will allocate dormitories randomly within classes. In 2020, Wang Qing decided to select a part of the dormitory and artificially interfere with the direction of dormitory relations.

;

;At the beginning, considering that there were many female students in the College of Humanities, Wang Qing decided to start with the female college dormitories. She selected 38 freshmen girls from four classes, and organized a group activity of "making love together" once a month after enrolling in the dormitory, a total of three times.

;

;Later, it was discovered that the conflicts in the boys’ dormitories were more serious, but they were not good at asking for help. Wang Qing learned from research that the physical conflict rate in boys' dormitories is higher, and the degree of intimacy and integration and satisfaction with interpersonal relationships in the dormitories are also lower than those in girls' dormitories.

;

;The theme of the activity is related to the mechanism of dormitory relations. Wang Qing analyzed that dormitories are spaces where public and private attributes are mixed, where individuals eat and sleep, but where strangers live together. In such a space, students need to learn how to grasp the scale - what is the place where individuals can play, and where is the place where others should be respected.

;

;The theme of the first event is public order. Wang Qing simulated a scene: At 11 o'clock in the evening, you are very tired and want to sleep, so you close your eyes. Your roommate is anxiously catching up on homework and typing on the computer. Wang Qing hopes that through empathy, the dormitory group can form the first agreement: strictly abide by the work and rest system and not interfere with others.

;

;To this end, she developed a 27-page intervention manual, which planned the process of each activity and mentioned common dormitory crises such as "small groups". She tried to guide students to think about how to solve these situations when they happened in their dormitories.

;

;At the end of the three activities, the students’ feedback achieved the results she expected. They underwent two tests to compare the development of the quality of interpersonal relationships in the dormitory before and after the event. The survey included tense situations such as cold wars and verbal conflicts, as well as collective activities and emotional exchanges within the dormitory. The students were also asked what they thought about the situation. How satisfied are you with the dormitory relationship, and whether you want to apply for a dormitory change.

;

;Another 36 female college students who had not participated in the activities also accepted this test. Comparing the two, Wang Qing concluded that appropriate communication intervention can indeed eliminate interpersonal conflicts and alienation in advance.

;

;After 2020, Wang Qing will no longer serve as the head teacher. Ru Jingfei, who has been a counselor for seven years and has tutored more than 1,200 students, has discovered that there are more and more dormitory conflicts among college students, and they tend to break out in lower grades. She was once called to the student dormitory in the middle of the night to deal with a fight. "If you can, just mediate. If it doesn't work, you have to change (dormitory)."

;

;Wang Qing introduced that at present, China’s intervention against conflicts in college student dormitories generally focuses on post-event repair and remediation. From the perspective of school management, some dormitories with poor relations can be regularly selected for intervention. However, Wang Qing also knows very well that as time goes by, the effect of the original intervention will become weaker and weaker.

;

;One reason is that the concepts, psychology and behavioral logic of the new generation of students are changing.

;

;;Lying talk sessions have become a legend;

;

;In today’s school administrators’ vision, intervention in dormitory allocation can avoid some foreseeable conflicts earlier. . A survey of 3,875 college students across the country by Shanghai Ocean University showed that the main reasons why students are dissatisfied with dormitory relationships are work and rest habits, personal hygiene, introversion/extroversion personality, and whether to play games.

;

;However, intervening in dormitory allocation is not a one-time solution. Ru Jingfei believes that even if the allocation method has been optimized, it can only solve superficial conflicts such as work and rest. She and other counselors often discuss that students’ self-awareness has become stronger and they are exposed to more information, which has brought about changes in dormitory relationships.

;

;When chatting with Wang Qing, a counselor said that students born in the 1970s and 1980s would think that roommates may be very important partners in life. They have a great influence not only during the study period, but also after graduation. Later, it can also become a boost for emotional and career growth. But now, many children have very clear goals after entering college: enrolling in graduate school, going abroad... From the beginning of their freshman year, they will arrange their lives according to their goals, and will not participate in group activities such as dinner parties. The dormitory may just be their own resting place. .

;

;Digitalization is also exacerbating this individual loneliness.

;

;When Wang Qing went to college about 20 years ago, mobile phones were only used for making calls and sending text messages. A very important dormitory activity at that time was sleeping in bed after lights out. “Nowadays, many children actually don’t have beds. Talk, everyone is very busy, mobile phones can meet many needs, and the connection, intimacy and integration between people will be reduced a lot."

;

;The Psychology Center of Beijing University of Chemical Technology reported in 2019 The school conducted a survey among 400 students. More than 80% of the students believed that the relationship in the dormitory was harmonious, but nearly half admitted that there were frictions in getting along. When asked to describe the relationship in the dormitory in one sentence, 40% chose "like family", while more people chose "ordinary friends".

;

;Wang Qing, who is no longer the head teacher, is still worried about the situation of the students. "(dormitory conflicts) occur every year, so I think this is not an accidental problem. A large part of the group will have such problems during their studies."

;

;Lu Jiahui is also not sure about the effect of dormitory allocation. She plans to verify the effect of dormitory allocation in mid-September and conduct an offline or online anonymous survey on freshmen who are willing to be interviewed to ask them how they get along with their roommates.

;

;Some more acute problems cannot be avoided by dormitory allocation. Wang Qing gave an example. For example, if two people in the dormitory happen to be two candidates for the scholarship, they may have potential conflicts of interest. In addition, professional views, conduct, etc. may also cause conflicts.

;

;Wang Qing wrote the 2020 experiment in the article "Analysis of the Intervention Effect of Intervention on Interpersonal Relationships in Female College Students' Dormitories". In the article, she concluded: The quality of interpersonal relationships in college students' dormitories is the highest at the beginning of getting along, and will be followed later. progressively worse.

;

;What a student said to Wang Qing left a deep impression on her: "My roommate is not my friend, we just live together."

; Wed, 20 Sep 2023 22:55:05 +0800 发明了火药的中国，为何明清时火器技术落后了？http://www.infzm.com/contents/257188

;

;Gunpowder is one of the four great inventions in ancient China, but there are also some controversies surrounding gunpowder. For example, Lu Xun said "Foreign countries use Gunpowder is used to make bullets to defend enemies, but China uses it to make firecrackers to worship gods." Another example is that in recent years, some people on the Internet have claimed that yellow gunpowder invented by Europeans in the 19th century is the real gunpowder.

;

;These two statements are debatable. After China discovered gunpowder, it was used to make various firearms for use on the battlefield. The world moved from the Middle Ages to modern times, and the entire process relied on black gunpowder. Yellow gunpowder greatly accelerated this process in the late modern period, but the significance of black gunpowder cannot be ignored, and without black gunpowder as the basis, Europeans would not have been able to invent yellow gunpowder. gunpowder.

;

;The huge potential of Chinese firearms

;

;Gunpowder first appeared in Taoist priests' alchemy furnaces and was used as medicine. Ancient medicine believed that saltpeter can cure internal heat and stomach bloating, and sulfur can "convert gold, silver, copper and iron". The two together are a kind of medicine for treating diseases, so they are called gunpowder. "Compendium of Materia Medica" believes that "gunpowder can expel insects and ward off evil spirits."

;

;The "Synopsis of the True Yuan Miao Dao", written in the mid-Tang Dynasty, records the power of the earliest gunpowder. Burning saltpeter, sulfur, realgar and honey together can cause deflagration and quickly burn the house clean. .

;

;After the invention of gunpowder, it was quickly used on the battlefield. Some people used "flying fire" in the melee between warlords in the late Tang Dynasty. The "Wu Jing Zong Yao" of the Northern Song Dynasty recorded the formula of gunpowder at that time. The saltpeter content used in the explosion was very low, but the content of various combustion accelerants such as oil, rosin, and asphalt was very high. This shows the role of gunpowder in war at this time. It was an incendiary bomb rather than a bomb or bullet. In addition, the gunpowder at this time was sometimes added with arsenic to burn it and poison the enemy. It can be said to be the earliest chemical weapon in the world.

;

;Throughout the Tang Dynasty and Northern Song Dynasty, Chinese gunpowder was often used to make incendiary weapons, such as gunpowder arrows, fire caltrops, fire poles, poison smoke balls, and artillery (cannon stones coated with gunpowder and thrown by catapults) etc., are all incendiary firearms. Among them, the gunpowder arrow developed by Feng Jisheng in the early Song Dynasty used the recoil of burning gunpowder to push the arrow. It can be said to be the prototype of today's rocket.

;

;However, in terms of technical content and effectiveness, these firearms did not surpass those of their contemporaries in Europe. In 678 AD, when the Eastern Roman Empire faced a siege of 200,000 troops from the Arab Empire, it used copper pipes to spray "Greek fire" to burn enemy ships and annihilate the huge Arab navy. The formula of "Greek Fire" has been lost, but it should be a petroleum-based compound that can burn on the water surface and is extremely powerful when combined with mechanical spray. "Greek Fire" has long since become a secret weapon guarding the sea of ​​Constantinople. Many powerful enemies were defeated by "Greek Fire" and were helpless.

;

;In the era of confrontation between the Song and Jin Dynasties, due to frequent wars between the Song and Jin Dynasties, both sides invented new firearms to assist in combat, and Chinese firearms achieved great development.

;

;Song general Chen Gui invented the musket. Although its function was closer to a flamethrower than a firearm at this time, the design of the tubular bamboo tube prepared the conditions for the firearm; Song general Wei Sheng invented the "Ruyi Zhan" for installing muskets. "Car", pulled by animal power. In the Southern Song Dynasty, all warships were equipped with trebuchets that threw artillery (incendiary bombs). When Wanyan Liang invaded the Song Dynasty, the Song general Li Bao led the navy to surprise the Jin army's naval base Chenjia Island, using rockets, artillery, etc. to burn Firearms completely annihilated the huge Jin Army naval division. It can be said that China's water warfare weapons have reached the level of "Greek fire" at this time. The Southern Song Dynasty gunboats can be regarded as the earliest gunboats in the world.

;

;The Jin people invented the world's earliest artillery - iron artillery for sieges; flying muskets that burned better than bamboo pole muskets, which can be called individual flamethrowers; and iron cans for storing gunpowder. The sky-shattering thunder made was ignited and thrown out. The sound was scary, and the exploded iron can fragments spattered damage to the surroundings. It can be said to be the earliest bomb in the world.

;

;During the Song-Mongolian War, the Song Dynasty invented the earliest firearm - the bamboo musket, which fired bullets to kill the enemy as far as 150 steps. In the Yuan Dynasty, the musket was Bamboo was changed to metal, and metal fire guns were created. By the end of the Yuan Dynasty, they had become popular in the military. However, until the early Yuan Dynasty, China's firearms were still mainly incendiary firearms.

;

;From the Southern Song Dynasty to the Yuan Dynasty, Chinese firearms basically cover all categories of thermal weapons still in use until modern times. However, the Islamic world quickly learned various categories of Chinese firearms, and was even better in research and development. After being introduced to Europe, European firearms developed rapidly, leaving the rest of the world far behind.

;

;The Middle East and Europe came from behind

;

;The Song Dynasty was the golden age of trade and cultural exchanges between China and the Islamic world. Many Arabs, Persians, and Central Asians settled in China and were even employed by the Song Dynasty. army, who quickly spread their knowledge of gunpowder and firearms back to Arabia. In addition, the Mongolians widely used firearms against the Islamic world during their Western Expeditions, which also promoted their learning of firearms.

;

;In 1240, the botanist Ibn Beytar of Al-Andalus (now southern Spain) introduced Chinese saltpeter in his book "Medical Prescriptions" and called it "Chinese snow salt". "Fire and saltpeter" introduced its deflagration properties. In 1256, Kublai Khan's brother Hulagu established the Ilkhanate in Persia. Hassan Rahman, a Syrian who served in the Ilkhanate, wrote a military book "Equestrianism and War Strategies", which introduced China in detail. Firearms, gunpowder formulas and saltpeter purification technologies.

;

;West Asia and North Africa were originally rich in sulfur, but they did not know the use of nitrate, so they failed to invent gunpowder. Once they knew how to synthesize gunpowder, firearms developed rapidly in the Islamic world. The Mamluk dynasty that ruled Egypt created a new type of firearm "Madafa" based on the musket.

;

;The "Motor Method" replaced the Chinese bamboo gun barrel with a larger wooden barrel, and replaced the Chinese projectiles with stone balls. In fact, it transformed the musket into the prototype of modern artillery; there is also a The method of loading arrows in wooden tubes and using gunpowder to push iron arrows to attack may come from the tradition of crossbows in the Mediterranean region. Later, the earliest artillery in Europe also used iron arrows to attack, and it was probably influenced by this.

;

;The motor method is actually superior to the firearms of the Yuan Dynasty and the Mongol Khanates. Moreover, the Arabs in the Middle Ages liked to experiment. The chemistry derived from alchemy was very outstanding, and the purification of gunpowder was also better than that of China. It can be said that they are catching up from behind. In other words, in the future, Europeans will learn firearms from the Islamic world from a higher starting point than China.

;

;The earliest document recording firearms in Europe is the coronation address written by the Bishop of London for King Edward III in 1326. Below the coronation address is a picture of a bottle-shaped cannon, which uses gunpowder to shoot giant arrows. In Europe, the Italian city-states who were constantly striving for hegemony were the first to master the manufacturing technology of firearms. Later, firearms were also mastered by Britain, France and Germany, and they showed great glory in the Hundred Years' War between England and France.

;

;It was during the Hundred Years War that European artillery shifted its goal from killing people to siegeing cities. Europeans began to build huge cannons that could collapse city walls, and built larger and larger cannons in the competition. .

;

;In 1375, French cannon makers cast a huge cannon weighing 2,000 pounds (about 900 kilograms) in Caen. Two years later, Philip the Brave, King of Burgundy, blasted it with a huge cannon. He defeated the British at Alderac Castle and proved the value of the cannon. In the second half of the Hundred Years' War, King Henry V of England used huge artillery to capture dozens of castles in France. Later, King Charles VII of France established the most efficient artillery in Europe, sweeping across the British army and recovering more than half of the country occupied by the British. France.

;

;The Europeans installed this kind of giant cannon on ships. In the Age of Discovery, they were invincible. Vasco da Gama led a few gunboats to travel across East Africa and India, equipped with dozens of giant cannons. The ships can often easily defeat enemies several times, ten times or even dozens of times larger. During the colonial expansion, the Europeans built bastions and deployed huge cannons in the colonies, which frightened thousands of indigenous troops and left them helpless. Europeans easily gained control of the entire world's seas through gunboats and fortresses, and dominated modern history.

;

;The artillery from Western Europe also returned to Eastern Europe. The Russians used advanced guns and artillery to blow up the Mongolian khanates and advance rapidly toward the east. The Islamic world also introduced advanced firearms from Western Europe, and three gunpowder empires emerged, including the Ottoman Empire, the Safavid Empire of Persia, and the Mughal Empire of India. Even Central Asia, which was relatively isolated in modern times, had self-made weapons because of the teachings of the Ottoman Empire. Arquebus and light artillery capabilities.

;

;In 1453, the Ottoman Sultan Mehmet II captured Constantinople and eliminated the Byzantine Empire. The exaggerated Urban cannon played a major role, and the Sudanese pro-army Yeniceri was also an excellent force. Musket Army. In 1526, Babur, the relic of the Timur Empire, marched into India. In the Battle of Panipat, he used artillery to defeat the elephant soldiers of the Delhi Sultanate. He entered India and established the Mughal Empire. Later, the Mughal Empire set up a cannon factory. , a standing army with 70 guns. Due to poor road conditions, it was difficult for Persia to use giant cannons, and the use of firearms lagged behind. However, in the early 18th century, Nader Shah, who replaced the Safavid dynasty, used advanced muskets imported from Europe and camel-borne Wasp cannons to sweep through Persia and India. , Central Asia, defeated the Ottoman army many times, and became the last great conqueror in history.

;

;The system of the Ming and Qing Dynasties brought the glory of Chinese firearms to an end

;

;While firearms are advancing rapidly around the world, China, which invented firearms, has been left behind.

;

;Emperor Kangxi of the Qing Dynasty was amazed by the performance of the Dzungar firearm "Zanbalak". During the reign of Emperor Yongzheng, he copied it on a large scale and equipped it for the Qing army, which later developed into a gun. This kind of "Zanbarak" is a camel-borne wasp cannon, but it is an outdated weapon invented by the Mamluk Dynasty three to four hundred years before Emperor Kangxi. Although it is still somewhat unique in the geographical environment of Persia and Central Asia, Function, but it is several eras behind the advanced artillery in Western Europe.

;

;The firearms in the Middle East and Europe overtook China in the Yuan Dynasty, mainly because the intensity of the war at that time was not high, and there was no need to improve firearms like the Europeans who fought every day. At the end of the Yuan Dynasty, the uprising army revived firearms. However, the firearms of Zhu Yuanzhang and other heroes in the late Yuan Dynasty all followed the path of weight rather than quality. Although the Ming army's firepower equipment rate reached 10% during the Hongwu period, with hundreds of thousands of firepower soldiers, the level of firearms may not reach the level of the Song Dynasty, let alone compare with Europe at the same time.

;

;When Zhu Yuanzhang fought against Chen Youliang at Poyang Lake, the "big bowl mouth barrel" he used was an anti-personnel shotgun, the "no help" was an incendiary bomb, and the so-called "artillery" was a trebuchet to throw incendiary bombs. Burn enemy warships. When attacking Zhang Shicheng's last stronghold in Suzhou, Zhu Yuanzhang used catapults instead of cannons to attack the city.

;

;It can be seen that in the use of firearms in the troubled times of the late Yuan Dynasty, the transformation of European firearms into giant cannons was not seen. American sinologist Ouyang Tai believes that this is because China's rammed earth city walls are too thick to be destroyed by giant cannons, so there is no need to build giant cannons. However, Zhu Yuanzhang always used catapults that were much less powerful than giant cannons when he attacked the city. It can be seen that siege equipment does not necessarily rush to destroy the city wall, and there is no reason to give up the development of giant cannons. It should be because the overall technical level of Zhu Yuanzhang's army is too low and they cannot build them.

;

;After seizing the world, Zhu Yuanzhang closed the country on the one hand and suppressed the people who killed the soldiers on the other. This resulted in a gap in knowledge and technology, and many technologies may have been lost as a result. Although the Ming army has a high firearms equipment rate, the Ming Dynasty has strictly prohibited private ownership and research and development of firearms since the founding of the country. Local governments cannot make their own firearms and must uniformly deploy them through the court, thus eliminating the possibility of society improving firearms on its own.

;

;For the above reasons, the firearms of the Ming Dynasty were very backward. In the middle period, when the Portuguese appeared on the southeastern coast, their pre-loaded eagle cannons that could be fired continuously were regarded as artifacts by the Ming army. They called them "Flan cannons" and copied them. However, this kind of cannon was not popular in Europe at that time. It is already outdated and second-rate. Later, the ordinary naval guns of the Dutch became the "Red Yi cannons" used by the Ming army to save lives in the war with the Jianzhou Jurchens. The first ones the Ming army fished from sunken ships were fished from the sea.

;

;Even the Ottoman Empire muskets, whose performance was obviously inferior to that of Europe, were modified by the Ming Dynasty Zhao Shizhen into the "Rumi gun" (Rumi means Rome, and the Ottomans regarded themselves as Rome), which was regarded as a sharp weapon. It can be seen that the Ming Dynasty The level of firearms is low.

;

;After the Jurchens suffered continuously under the Ming army's Hongyi artillery, they developed artillery on their own. With the guidance of the surrendered Ming army artillery team and European missionaries, their artillery use once led East Asia. However, as the Manchus learned from the Ming Dynasty and turned to isolation, these welcome changes gradually faded away. In 1724, Emperor Yongzheng expelled missionaries, and the Manchu Qing Dynasty's introduction of Western technology slowed down significantly. In 1776, after Emperor Qianlong pacified Jinchuan and Jinchuan, he achieved perfect martial arts and believed that there would be no trouble at home. In order to prevent firearms from flowing into the people, he destroyed a large number of firearms caught in the war. Made firearms, the pace of China's firearms innovation came to an abrupt end.

;

;Some overseas sinologists believe that China's unified system does not have as many wars as Europe, which is the biggest reason for the sluggish development of firearms in China. However, in fact, during the Ming and Qing Dynasties, there were no wars to quell civil unrest and bring people back home. There were quite a few, some on a very large scale, but they did not promote the development of firearms.

;

;The most important reason is that the Ming and Qing Dynasties reversed the enlightened attitude of the Tang and Song Dynasties and reached their peak in preventing social autocracy. They were the masters of the Qin system and tried to monopolize the most advanced firearms technology as far as the eye could see. Not only is it closed to the country, cutting off economic and technological exchanges with the West, but it is also unwilling to allow the private sector to promote the research and development and upgrading of firearms. Naturally, the entire society has no enthusiasm and motivation for researching firearms.

;

;When the emperors of the Ming and Qing Dynasties felt that the dynasty was in a military crisis, they would also vigorously introduce advanced European firearms, which shows that they have the ability to learn advanced technology. If this continues, even if the research and development is poor, they will not lag behind Europe. is too big. But once the crisis has passed, it will cut off ties with overseas countries and ignore the booming development of firearms outside the region until the Europeans knock on the country's door with powerful ships and cannons that the Manchus could not imagine.
